Princeton University Library Finding Aids

Toni Morrison Papers

  • Manuscripts Division
  • Contact
  • Summary Information
  • Description
  • Arrangement
  • Information for Users
  • Subject Headings
  • Contents List
  • Series 1: Writings

Summary Information

Creator:
Morrison, Toni. 1931-
Title and dates:
Toni Morrison Papers
1929-2015
bulk 1970-2015
Abstract:
Consists of Toni Morrison's writings (manuscripts, drafts, galleys, and proofs), published books, working files, teaching files, correspondence, research files, press, photographs, awards, and memorabilia.
Size:
200.43 linear feet
Call number:
C1491
Location:
Princeton University. Library. Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections
Manuscripts Division
Princeton, New Jersey 08544 USA
Language(s) of materials:
English
Storage note:
This collection is stored onsite at Firestone Library.

Description

Consists of Toni Morrison's writings (manuscripts, drafts, galleys, etc.), published books, working files, teaching files, correspondence, research files, student papers, awards, interviews, press, and memorabilia.

Arrangement

The collection is arranged into the following series: Series 1. Writings Subseries 1. Novels Series 2. Correspondence Series 3. Random House Series 4. Toni Cade Bambara Posthumous Publications Series 5. Academic Career Subseries 1. SUNY Albany Subseries 2. Princeton Subseries 3. Teaching Files

  • Series 1: Writings, 1929 September-2015
  • Subseries 1: Novels, 1929 September-20151970-2015

Access and Use

Access

The collection is open for research. Toni Morrison's manuscript material, including drafts, typescripts, galleys, and proofs, are available only via digital access in the reading room.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Some material in this collection, particularly found in Series 1: Writings and Series 2: Correspondence, was damaged by the fire that destroyed Morrison's upstate New York home in 1993. Damage ranges from charred edges to pages missing significant portions or rendered illegible.

Restrictions on Use and Copyright Information

Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. No further photoduplication of copies of material in the collection can be made when Princeton University Library does not own the original. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Associate University Librarian for Rare Books and Special Collections. The library has no information on the status of literary rights in the collection and researchers are responsible for determining any questions of copyright.

Acquisition and Appraisal

Provenance and Acquisition

2009 (AM 2015-62). 2015 accruals: (AM 2015-74), (AM 2015-89), (AM 2015-98).

Appraisal

Nothing was removed from the collection during 2015-2016 processing.

Processing and Other Information

Conservation

Some materials in this collection were treated for fire damage and encapsulated in mylar in 1994.

Processing Information

This collection was processed by Allison Hughes in 2015-2016. Finding aid written by Allison Hughes in 2016.

Descriptive Rules Used

Finding aid content adheres to that prescribed by Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

Encoding

This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-04-26T18:13-0400

Language(s) of this Finding Aid

English

Preferred Citation

Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Toni Morrison Papers, Box and Folder Number; Department of Rare Books and Special Collections, Princeton University Library.

Subject Headings

  • Morrison, Toni.
  • African American authors -- 20th century -- Sources.
  • Authors, American -- 20th century -- Sources.
  • Novelists.
  • Women Nobel Prize winners.
  • Correspondence.
  • Fan mail.
  • Interviews.
  • Proofs (printed matter).
  • Typescripts.

Browse other finding aids related to the following terms:

  • American literature
  • Literature

Contents List

  1. Series 1: Writings, 1929 September-2015

    Description:

    Consists of research material, notes, outlines, drafts, galleys, and proofs. Yellow legal notepads contain notes, early draft material, and inserts for later typed and printed versions. Notepads are identified by their first lines, though a single notepad may contain a variety of material, including material relating to other works, correspondence drafts, and other unrelated notes. Corrected typescript and printout drafts often show significant revisions. Material from various stages of the publication process is present, including setting copies with copy-editor's and typesetter's marks, galleys, page proofs, F&Gs (folded and gathered pages not yet bound), blueline proofs ("confirmation blues"), advance copies (bound uncorrected proofs) and production/design material with page and dust-jacket samples.

    Arrangement:

    Arranged into the following subseries: 1. Novels. More subseries will be added as the collection is processed.

  2. Subseries 1: Novels, 1929 September-2015, bulk 1970-2015

    Description:

    All of Morrison's novels except Song of Solomon are represented (this material was likely destroyed in the 1993 fire).

    Arrangement:

    Arranged chronologically by publication date.

  3. The Bluest Eye, 1970

    Description:

    For the short story "Two of Eves," an early version of The Bluest Eye, see Subseries 2: Short Fiction.

  4. Outlines and Notes, undated

    Access:

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 1, Folder 1

  74. Outlines and Notes, undated

    Physical Characteristics: Typescript, corrected.

    Access:

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 13, Folder 5

    Pages 1-7.

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 22, Folder 4

    Physical Characteristics: Printout.

    Description:

    Pages 1-11.

    Access:

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 23, Folder 4

    Physical Characteristics: Printout, corrected.

    Description:

    Pages 1-4.

    Access:

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 24, Folder 5

    Access:

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 32, Folder 9

  425. "The train slowed...", 1994 September 6

    Physical Characteristics: Printout, corrected.

    Description:

    Pages 23-25.

    Access:

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 34, Folder 17

    Pages 1-10.

    Access:

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 36, Folder 2

  523. Love, 1999 January 28-2003

    Description:

    Working titles Sporting Woman (abbreviated Sp. W)and L. Note that chapter drafts are grouped according to their name and order in the published book, although, as their individual titles reflect, they were renamed and reordered throughout the writing process.

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 41, Folder 22

    View PDF     		Box 42, Folder 5

    Pages 1-14.

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 43, Folder 2

  725. Chapter 10 (Material for), circa 1999-2003

    Physical Characteristics: Printout, corrected.

    Description:

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 43, Folder 7

  769. A Mercy, 2006-2009

    Description:

Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 60, Folder 1

    Pages 1-215.

    Access:

    Toni Morrison has required the Library to make surrogate copies of all of her manuscripts (including typescripts and proofs) and diaries (appointment books), including but not restricted to those damaged by fire in 1993. This is for conservation reasons, to prevent damage and deterioration by repeated use. Researchers are required to use digital surrogates in the reading room of the Department of Rare Books and Special Collections.

    View PDF     		Box 65, Folder 5
